page.title: 18STYLE & OWNERSHIP OF HOUSES
page.content: Linkenholt houses are estate owned with no new houses. Three are brick and flint with thatch, the rest brick of Victorian style. The Manor House, rebuilt 1912, is let. The Old Rectory is let for 20 years under a repairing lease for nominal rent. The oldest house, Manor Farm, is converted into flats. One house in Faccombe is privately owned, the remainder owned by the estate, including 10 built 1979. The older houses have been modernised with central heating by wood burning stoves. Of the 39 houses, seven are in Netherton. These are brick & flint, thatched cotages with 1 modern brick bungalow and a fine Georgian Old Rectory.
